competencies.name: Driver conducts daily checks listed in Defect Book in a well-lit area away from main traffic routes
Driver checks First Aid box including eye wash to ensure it is complete
Driver checks the external cleanliness of the vehicle including lights, number plates , indicators and windows
Driver checks that the cab is clean and free from unauthorised items
Any defects identified and reported to appropriate personnel
competencies.supportingText: 1. What is the procedure for reporting defects to appropriate personnel?

competencies.name: Driver wears high-visibility clothing provided by the company together with any other relevant personal protective equipment
Driver has required documentation for their load
Driver ensures that only authorised passengers ride in the vehicle and that seat belts are worn at required times
competencies.supportingText: 1. Why are unauthorised passengers not allowed to ride in the vehicle?

competencies.name: Driver ensures that employees do not ride on the back or any other part of the vehicle
competencies.supportingText: 1. Why is it important that employees do not ride on the back or any other part of the vehicle?

competencies.name: Driver ensures the safety self, the public and other road users when stopping, starting and positioning the vehicle

Driver operates vehicle safely:
  1. following public highway traffic convention
  2. with due consideration to others
Driver ensures that no loading takes place while the vehicle is in motion
Driver check that the vehicle is loaded safely with no over-loading or overhanging items
competencies.supportingText:
1. Why is it necessary to remove over-hanging items?
  2. Why is it necessary to check the vehicle is not over-loaded?

competencies.name: Reversing operations are conducted safely following company procedure (or as detailed in WAP9)
Driver ensures that the vehicle is not driven with the loading arms raised in the air
Driver checks that the vehicle is not overloaded
Driver checks that there are no overhanging items
Driver checks that the load is evenly distributed
Driver carries out a physical inspection of the waste at the top of the container to ensure that the waste is as described
Driver checks that there are no persons in the container
Driver reports to supervisor if inspection could endanger own safety
competencies.supportingText:
1. Under what circumstances would it be unsafe to inspect the waste on the top of the container?
  2. What is the company procedure for informing your supervisor when it is unsafe to inspect the waste on the top of the container?

competencies.name: Driver ensures only authorised persons operate the lifting equipment
Driver is aware of and complies with all site safety rules when on customer’s premises or tipping sites
competencies.supportingText:
1. What are the major safety rules that must be complied with on customer’s premises?
  2. What are the major safety rules that must be complied with on tipping sites?

competencies.name: Driver ensures that crew members comply with the safety rules on tipping sites
competencies.supportingText: 1. How do you ensure that the crew know the safety rules and how do you check they comply with them?

competencies.name: Driver reverses with care to prevent the vehicle from going over the edge
Driver does not allow anyone to work under un-propped bodies
Driver does not allow anyone to climb into the hopper
Driver uses the correct work at height equipment when accessing the top of the vehicle to clear waste
competencies.supportingText: 1. What is the correct equipment to use when working at height when accessing the top of the vehicle to clear waste?

competencies.name: Driver provides supervisor with details of the vehicle location before accessing the top of the vehicle
competencies.supportingText: 1. What are the company procedures for notifying your supervisor of location of vehicle before accessing the top of the vehicle?

competencies.name: Driver accesses the canopy at the rear of the vehicle using the approved ladder that is securely fixed to the vehicle
competencies.supportingText: 1. What is the company procedure using and securing the correct ladder when accessing the canopy at the rear of the vehicle?

competencies.name: Driver contacts supervisor when correct ladder is not available and requests attendance of a vehicle fitter
competencies.supportingText: 1. What are the company procedures for notifying your supervisor when correct ladder is not available?

competencies.name: Driver contacts supervisor when a container has fallen from the forks into the hopper and does not move the vehicle
competencies.supportingText: 1. What are the company procedures for notifying your supervisor of containers which have fallen from the forks into the hopper?

competencies.name: Driver gains access through the dedicated hatch to the blade for clearing using the approved ladder type, which is attached securely to the vehicle
Driver defects any vehicle without a functioning working light
Driver ensures that only one person works behind the blade at any one time and that the person working has possession of the ignition key
